definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: The Melody of Happiness has been played on their course of growth.
sentences.chinese: 快乐分享的主旋律，涤荡在他们终将难忘的成长之路。

sentences.english: Russian-US relations is still the main theme of cooperation, but there are contradictions and frictions.
sentences.chinese: 俄美关系的主旋律仍是合作，但是也有矛盾和摩擦。

sentences.english: Refusal to face up to the truth is becoming a theme.
sentences.chinese: 拒绝直面真相正在成为主旋律。

sentences.english: This is the main theme of our new era.
sentences.chinese: 这才是我们新时代的主旋律。

sentences.english: This year’s Celebrity 100 was themed around celebrity entrepreneurs.
sentences.chinese: 今年福布斯全球100名人榜的主旋律是名人企业家。

sentences.english: "Desert and spring of love" became the master melody in Mauriac's creation.
sentences.chinese: “爱的荒漠与甘泉”成为莫里亚克创作中的主旋律。

sentences.english: The consciousness of time and life was main melody of the poetry images from the Wei8c Jin to the Liu Song Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 时间与生命意识是魏晋至刘宋时代诗歌意象的主旋律。

sentences.english: The principle of joining and layering forms the general urban and architectural leitmotif.
sentences.chinese: 组合及布局的原则形成了总体城市和建筑的主旋律。

sentences.english: In the fugue’s development the subject is augmented.
sentences.chinese: 在赋格曲的主题展开中主旋律的音被延长了。

sentences.english: It is called Le Tigre Tour Theme.
sentences.chinese: 歌名是《老虎之旅的主旋律》。

sentences.english: Since the beginning of 21st century, convergence has been the main trend of information communications industry.
sentences.chinese: 进入21世纪以来，融合成为信息通信产业的主旋律。

sentences.english: "Human-oriented" is the main theme of educational reforms.
sentences.chinese: “以人为本”是教育改革的主旋律。

sentences.english: You must change the theme song in your mind from You SUCK to You ROCK.
sentences.chinese: 你必须把你内心的主旋律由苦逼变成主动出击的状态。

sentences.english: Of course, there are variations to this theme.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这一主旋律也有变奏。

definition: main stream (of a river)/fig. the essential point/main viewpoint of a matter/mainstream (culture etc)
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
